poem:
The Security Zone  

Under moonless skies, a border whispers  
between fear and flesh,  
where a law sharpens like a knife.  
Words become walls,  
quiet stories of laughter and bread  
swept into shadows.  
Tomorrow wakes,  
bearing the echo of boots  
dancing on cobblestones,  
the air heavy with unspoken songs,  
each breath a hushed refrain.

Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
